title: Use Google AdSense in Angular
body:
In the normal SSR, it is possible to distribute ads and monetize the automatic ads script for Google AdSense in the `<head> </head>`.

However, in the case of SPA, if only automatic advertisement is used, there is no reloading of page transitions, so the number of advertisements displayed, such as only fixed ads at the bottom of the page, will often decrease.

Therefore, you can manually configure the advertising frame by using [ng2-adsense] (https://www.npmjs.com/package/ng2-adsense).

### NG2-adsense introduction

Environment: Angular V13

1. `NPM INSTALL NG2-ADSENSE`

2. Describe the settings in `app.module.ts` (Module linked to the component you want to display ads, or with Module created for common use.)

`` `TS
@Ngmodule ({
  DECLARATIONS: [AppComponent],
  IMPORTS: [
    Browsermodule,
    ApproutingModule,
    Adsensemodule.forroot ({Adclient: 'Ca-Pub- **************
  ],,
  Providers: [],
  Bootstrap: [AppComponent],
})
Export Class Appmodule {}
`` `

4. Add the layout component you want to display in the area you want to display

`` `HTML
<ng2-adsense
  Style = "Display: Block"
  Adformat = "fluid"
  slot = "********"
  Layoutkey = "**********"
> </NG2-ADSENSE>
`` `

Use the settings set from Google AdSense for settings such as slot, layoutKey.

! [Image] (https://user- Images.githubuserContent.com/29157528/158059598-f309054A-618F-46AA-AA80-b013a392894b.png)

! [Image] (https://user- Images.githubuserContent.com/29157528/158059662-bfd1a4D8-778C-4E6C-83DB0E7C8402.png)

SLOTs displayed in ^are supported.

You can display ads by setting the above.

I want automatic advertisements to be available in SPA, but I feel that it seems a little harsh considering the advertisements that are sandwiched between page transitions.
